subject: RE: [junit] black box or white box?
msgSnippet: ... [...] ... So what are your solid enough contracts? How do you find those contracts by looking at nothing but an interface definition? Johannes -- GMX -
messageBody:
> > Sometimes the (public) contract cannot be made sufficiently
> > strong beforehand. Especially when the objects and interfaces
> > are in the midst of evolving.
>
> They can be made solid enough. I myself also do iterative
> development. I work toward the usage of the component before
> I focus on 100% functionality.

[...]

> interface Store
> {
> void store(String key, Object val);
> Object retrieve(String key);
> void remove(String key);
> }
>
> That interface is enough to know how to use the object store.

So what are your "solid enough" contracts? How do you find those contracts
by looking at nothing but an interface definition?

Johannes
